Alice has to buy two gifts, each for $100, for two birthday parties in 1 week. How much money will Alice need?
100*2

Betty goes to a library for 5 hours twice a week. At first, she borrowed 2 books per week. With the increasing availability of reading materials, the amount steadily increased to 5 books per week. How many books does Betty borrow per week currently?
Betty has been going to libraries twice a week for 5 hours so that means 2*5 = 10 hours
After the increase in availability of reading materials, Betty has been going to the library twice a week for 5 hours for a while until the amount steadily increased to 7 books per week
This means for a while Betty has been borrowing 7-5=2 books per week extra for 10 hours per week
In total that means 2 books per week + 5 books per week before = 7 books per week.
Currently Betty borrows 7 books per week from the library. (7 books per week for 7-1=6 weeks) * (1 week =7 days) = 42 books every two weeks
Therefore Betty borrows now 42/2=21 books every week.

How many books does Betty borrow per week currently? Answer: 21 books per week.
Please provide the next question. Thank you!
